keyword: calories in spaghetti with meat sauce
title: Calories in Spaghetti with Meat Sauce
meta_description: Learn calories in spaghetti with meat sauce per 1-cup serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition facts for easy tracking.
h1: Calories in Spaghetti with Meat Sauce
assumptions: 1 cup (250g) cooked spaghetti with tomato-based meat sauce (ground beef, tomatoes, onions, garlic, herbs); no added cheese or oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, meat type, sauce brand, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One cup of spaghetti with meat sauce provides ~350 kcal, 18 g protein, and 40 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Use ground turkey instead of beef

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of spaghetti with meat sauce?
What's the protein in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Roughly 18 g protein per 1-cup serving, mainly from the meat.

faqs.q: Is spaghetti with meat sauce high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 40 g carbs per cup, mostly from the pasta.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Approximately 600 mg per 1-cup serving; varies with sauce ingredients.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Yes, use leaner meat, more veggies, or smaller portions to cut ~50-100 kcal.
